text: Boris Markovich Berlatsky (1889—1937) was a senior official of the State Bank of the USSR. He was 41 when he was a defendant in 1931 Menshevik Trial, one of the first show trials in the Soviet Union. Berlatsky's "confession" included an account of how he met with Fyodor Dan, Rudolph Hilferding, Van der Velde, Karl Kautsky and Leon Blum while in Berlin in 1925. He was sentenced to four years in prison. ==References== Category:Victims of Red Terror in Soviet Russia Category:1889 births Category:1937 deaths
